CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Phone Screen stage positioned above or below the HR Interview stage?
SRP.A: The Phone Screen stage is positioned {above} the HR Interview stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {exponential} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage HR Interview?
VE.A: The value of stage HR Interview is {22%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Technical Interview?
VE.A: The value of stage Technical Interview is {18%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Application Submitted?
VE.A: The value of stage Application Submitted is {68%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Job Posting Viewed, with a value of {100%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Technical Interview, with a value of {18%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage HR Interview to stage Technical Interview?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage HR Interview to stage Technical Interview is {4%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Job Posting Viewed to stage Application Submitted?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Job Posting Viewed to stage Application Submitted is {32%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 53%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Job Posting Viewed} stage has {100%}, the {Application Submitted} stage has {68%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 53%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Phone Screen} stage has {39%}, the {HR Interview} stage has {22%}, the {Technical Interview} stage has {18%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 20% and 84%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Application Submitted} stage has {68%}, the {Phone Screen} stage has {39%}, the {HR Interview} stage has {22%}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Job Posting Viewed to Application Submitted, or from stage Application Submitted to Phone Screen?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Job Posting Viewed} to {Application Submitted} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Phone Screen to HR Interview, from stage HR Interview to Technical Interview, or from stage Job Posting Viewed to Application Submitted?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Job Posting Viewed} to stage {Application Submitted} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Job Posting Viewed} and {Application Submitted} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {HR Interview} and {Technical Interview} stages.
